pr_title: Implement a periodic workflow verifying the QS against the Quarkus master

timeline.bodyText: Might need to remove "success" as it reports failure too
timeline.author: cescoffier
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+---
+name: "Native Test - development"
+
+# Adding the dispatch event to allow restarting the build on demand
+on:
+  schedule:
+    - cron: '0 */6 * * *'
+  repository_dispatch:
+
+jobs:
+  build_with_native:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          ref: development
+
+      - uses: actions/cache@v1
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+
+      - name: Install JDK 8
+        uses: joschi/setup-jdk@v1.0.0
+        with:
+          java-version: 'openjdk8'
+
+      - name: Build Quarkus master
+        run: |
+          git clone https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus.git \
+          && cd quarkus \
+          && mvn -B clean install -DskipTests -DskipITs
+
+      - name: Build Quickstart with native
+        run: |
+          mvn -B clean install -Pnative \
+            -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true \
+            -pl "!software-transactional-memory-quickstart"
+
+      - name: Report Success

timeline.bodyText: I think we should open it on quarkusio/quarkus because I am afraid not enough people have eyeballs on the quarkus-quickstart project issues
timeline.author: emmanuelbernard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,101 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env kscript
+
+@file:MavenRepository("jcenter","https://jcenter.bintray.com/")
+@file:MavenRepository("maven-central","https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/")
+@file:DependsOn("org.kohsuke:github-api:1.101")
+
+
+import org.kohsuke.github.*
+import java.io.File
+import java.io.IOException
+import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit
+
+val token = args[0]; 
+val status = args[1];
+
+
+// Handle status. Possible values are success, failure, or cancelled.
+val succeed = status == "success";
+if (status == "cancelled") {
+    println("Job status is `cancelled` - exiting")
+    System.exit(0)
+}
+
+val ISSUE_TITLE = "Quickstarts Native Build failed against Quarkus Master"
+val REPO = "quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts"
+
+val github = GitHubBuilder().withOAuthToken(token).build()
+val repository = github.getRepository("quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts")

replies.bodyText: Yes, it should work. I need to check that the token I used has access to this repo.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Should work with the current token.
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText:
I wonder for the sake of simplicity if we should not have one issue that is closed and reopened when the quickstarts fail. My main (only reason) is that we can enforce that all the relevant persons are subscribed to the issue and they will get notification through GitHub. This will be more visible than a random new issue created.
Alternatively, we have a list of people we notify (I'd like to be a part of).
timeline.author: emmanuelbernard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,101 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env kscript
+
+@file:MavenRepository("jcenter","https://jcenter.bintray.com/")
+@file:MavenRepository("maven-central","https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/")
+@file:DependsOn("org.kohsuke:github-api:1.101")
+
+
+import org.kohsuke.github.*
+import java.io.File
+import java.io.IOException
+import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit
+
+val token = args[0]; 
+val status = args[1];
+
+
+// Handle status. Possible values are success, failure, or cancelled.
+val succeed = status == "success";
+if (status == "cancelled") {
+    println("Job status is `cancelled` - exiting")
+    System.exit(0)
+}
+
+val ISSUE_TITLE = "Quickstarts Native Build failed against Quarkus Master"
+val REPO = "quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts"
+
+val github = GitHubBuilder().withOAuthToken(token).build()
+val repository = github.getRepository("quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts")
+val issues = repository.getIssues(GHIssueState.OPEN)

replies.bodyText: We can do this, and use a single issue. We just need to be sure that no-one will ever create another issue with the same title.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: I like this idea, since subscriptions would just work as opposed to have the relevant constantly monitor for new issues. Perhaps add some kind of prefix to the title like [CI - GitHub Actions]
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I can definitely add [CI] and add the link to the action page (see next comment about the impossibility to retrieve the log from inside the workflow)
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: New title: [CI] - Quickstarts Native Build failed against Quarkus Master label area/infra.
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText: is it possible to point to the actual error like a jenkins-like report. I am not sure GitHub action has such facility so I'm asking. I'm trying to see what will be the first step of the person finding the regression, likely look at the error report to trim down the cause. If not the user would have to get the quickstarts and run quarkus-core and the quickstart tests locally.
timeline.author: emmanuelbernard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,101 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env kscript
+
+@file:MavenRepository("jcenter","https://jcenter.bintray.com/")
+@file:MavenRepository("maven-central","https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/")
+@file:DependsOn("org.kohsuke:github-api:1.101")
+
+
+import org.kohsuke.github.*
+import java.io.File
+import java.io.IOException
+import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit
+
+val token = args[0]; 
+val status = args[1];
+
+
+// Handle status. Possible values are success, failure, or cancelled.
+val succeed = status == "success";
+if (status == "cancelled") {
+    println("Job status is `cancelled` - exiting")
+    System.exit(0)
+}
+
+val ISSUE_TITLE = "Quickstarts Native Build failed against Quarkus Master"
+val REPO = "quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts"
+
+val github = GitHubBuilder().withOAuthToken(token).build()
+val repository = github.getRepository("quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts")
+val issues = repository.getIssues(GHIssueState.OPEN)
+val existingIssue = issues.firstOrNull { i -> i.getTitle() == ISSUE_TITLE}
+
+val quickstartsCommit = getRepositoryCommit(".")
+val quarkusCommit = getRepositoryCommit("quarkus")
+if (succeed) {
+    if (existingIssue != null) {
+        // close issue with a comment
+        val comment = existingIssue.comment("""
+            Build fixed with:
+
+            * Quarkus commit: ${quarkusCommit}
+            * Quickstarts commit: ${quickstartsCommit}               
+
+        """.trimIndent())        
+        existingIssue.close()
+        println("Comment added on issue ${existingIssue.getHtmlUrl()} - ${comment.getHtmlUrl()}, the issue has also been closed")
+    } else {
+        println("Nothing to do - the build passed and there are no issue to close")
+    }
+} else  {
+    // Build failed
+    if (existingIssue == null) {
+        // create a new issue
+        val newIssue = repository.createIssue(ISSUE_TITLE)
+            .body("""
+                The build of the  `development` branch of the quickstarts against quarkus `master` has failed.
+                This build verifies the native compilation and executes the native integration tests.
+
+                The build failed with:
+
+                * Quarkus commit: ${quarkusCommit}
+                * Quickstarts commit: ${quickstartsCommit}

replies.bodyText: unfortunately, it's where things get hairy... I didn't find a way to get the log, neither download it. I will have another look.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: ok, there is no way to do it for now... Even linking to the execution is not reliable.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Added a plain link to the actions page.
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText: 60 mins for git rev-parse HEAD, you have no faith in computers ;)
timeline.author: emmanuelbernard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,101 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env kscript
+
+@file:MavenRepository("jcenter","https://jcenter.bintray.com/")
+@file:MavenRepository("maven-central","https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/")
+@file:DependsOn("org.kohsuke:github-api:1.101")
+
+
+import org.kohsuke.github.*
+import java.io.File
+import java.io.IOException
+import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit
+
+val token = args[0]; 
+val status = args[1];
+
+
+// Handle status. Possible values are success, failure, or cancelled.
+val succeed = status == "success";
+if (status == "cancelled") {
+    println("Job status is `cancelled` - exiting")
+    System.exit(0)
+}
+
+val ISSUE_TITLE = "Quickstarts Native Build failed against Quarkus Master"
+val REPO = "quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts"
+
+val github = GitHubBuilder().withOAuthToken(token).build()
+val repository = github.getRepository("quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts")
+val issues = repository.getIssues(GHIssueState.OPEN)
+val existingIssue = issues.firstOrNull { i -> i.getTitle() == ISSUE_TITLE}
+
+val quickstartsCommit = getRepositoryCommit(".")
+val quarkusCommit = getRepositoryCommit("quarkus")
+if (succeed) {
+    if (existingIssue != null) {
+        // close issue with a comment
+        val comment = existingIssue.comment("""
+            Build fixed with:
+
+            * Quarkus commit: ${quarkusCommit}
+            * Quickstarts commit: ${quickstartsCommit}               
+
+        """.trimIndent())        
+        existingIssue.close()
+        println("Comment added on issue ${existingIssue.getHtmlUrl()} - ${comment.getHtmlUrl()}, the issue has also been closed")
+    } else {
+        println("Nothing to do - the build passed and there are no issue to close")
+    }
+} else  {
+    // Build failed
+    if (existingIssue == null) {
+        // create a new issue
+        val newIssue = repository.createIssue(ISSUE_TITLE)
+            .body("""
+                The build of the  `development` branch of the quickstarts against quarkus `master` has failed.
+                This build verifies the native compilation and executes the native integration tests.
+
+                The build failed with:
+
+                * Quarkus commit: ${quarkusCommit}
+                * Quickstarts commit: ${quickstartsCommit}               
+
+            """.trimIndent())
+            .create()
+        println("New issue created: ${newIssue.getTitle()} - ${newIssue.getHtmlUrl()}")    
+    } else {
+        // comment on issue
+        val comment = existingIssue.comment("""
+            Build still failing with:
+
+            * Quarkus commit: ${quarkusCommit}
+            * Quickstarts commit: ${quickstartsCommit}   
+
+        """.trimIndent())
+        println("Comment added on issue ${existingIssue.getHtmlUrl()} - ${comment.getHtmlUrl()}")
+
+    }
+}
+
+
+fun getRepositoryCommit(workingDir: String) : String {
+    return "git rev-parse HEAD".runCommand(workingDir)
+}
+
+fun String.runCommand(workingDir: String): String {
+    try {
+        val parts = this.split("\\s".toRegex())
+        val proc = ProcessBuilder(*parts.toTypedArray())
+                .directory(File(workingDir))
+                .redirectOutput(ProcessBuilder.Redirect.PIPE)
+                .redirectError(ProcessBuilder.Redirect.PIPE)
+                .start()
+
+        proc.waitFor(60, TimeUnit.MINUTES)

replies.bodyText: Oh... my faith is gone a long time ago... That's why I do reactive stuff :-D
replies.author: cescoffier

+      - uses: actions/cache@v1
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+
+      - name: Install JDK 8
+        uses: joschi/setup-jdk@v1.0.0
+        with:
+          java-version: 'openjdk8'
+
+      - name: Build Quarkus master
+        run: |
+          git clone https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus.git \
+          && cd quarkus \
+          && mvn -B clean install -DskipTests -DskipITs
+
+      - name: Build Quickstart with native
+        run: |
+          mvn -B clean install -Pnative \
+            -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true \
+            -pl "!software-transactional-memory-quickstart"

timeline.message: Implement a periodic workflow verifying the quickstart against the latest quarkus (master) including native build and IT
create a single issue (open and close by the script) in the main quarkus repository
Switch to use a single already created issue to report the build outcome
Now that the STM extension is fixed, re-enabled the quickstart
Now that the STM extension is fixed, re-enabled the quickstart
